title: Kendrick Lamar - Grand National Tour
articleDescription: Extra services on Wednesday 3 and Thursday 4 December at AAMI Park.
articleContent:
Kendrick Lamar will bring the Grand National Tour to Melbourne this summer at AAMI Park. 

Gates open at 5:30pm
Event begins at 7:00pm

Before you travel

If you use Journey Planner, you'll see all the extra services we've added to help you get there.

Metropolitan train

Wednesday 3 December

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Dandenong, Caulfield, Sandringham, Newport(Werribee ), Craigieburn and Sunbury passengers.

Frankston line passengers:

  • Board train service to Caulfield at Richmond (Platforms 4 & 6)
  • Change at Caulfield to a connecting bus to Frankston.

Werribee line passengers:

  • Board train service to Newport at Richmond (Platform 3) or Flinders Street (Platform 9)
  • Change at Newport to a connecting bus to Werribee.

Thursday 4 December

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Ringwood, Glen Waverley, Dandenong, Caulfield, Sandringham, Newport, Craigieburn and Sunbury passengers.

Frankston line passengers:

  • Board train service to Caulfield at Richmond (Platforms 4 & 6)
  • Change at Caulfield to a connecting bus to Frankston.

Werribee line passengers:

  • Board train service to Newport at Richmond (Platform 3) or Flinders Street (Platform 9)
  • Change at Newport to a connecting bus to Werribee.

Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Route 70

  • Trams will operate from Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena.

Metropolitan bus

Customers can catch the following buses close to the MCG:

  • Route 246

Please note, services may terminate prior to the end of the match.

Regional train

Wednesday 3 and Thursday 4 December

Additional services for the following lines arrive prior to the concert:

  • Wyndham Vale, Ballarat, Melton

Additional services for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Waurn Ponds

Return coaches for the following lines depart after the concert:

  • Seymour Line

Additional information

  • Download our free mobile apps for Android and iOS to get public transport information on the go. You can also top up your myki instantly in the app.
  • If you need accessibility information and assistance, see Accessibility.
  • Top up your myki before travelling or set Auto Top Up so you never need to top up again. For more information, see Auto Top Up.
  • Mobile myki is a new way to travel with myki. It’s a digital myki on your Android phone on the Google Wallet™ app.
  • For information about tickets for children and concessions, see Children and Concessions.
  • If you need more information or special assistance, please call 1800 800 007 before travelling.
